content.question: Which of the following best explains why the enthalpy change of the reaction represented is positive?

choices.label: The reaction is endothermic because breaking the <math alttext="O to O double" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo lspace="0.02em" rspace="0.02em">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> bond requires energy.

The reaction is endothermic because breaking the <math alttext="O to O double" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo lspace="0.02em" rspace="0.02em">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> bond releases energy.

The reaction is exothermic because breaking the <math alttext="O to O double" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo lspace="0.02em" rspace="0.02em">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> bond requires energy.

The reaction is exothermic because breaking the <math alttext="O to O double" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo lspace="0.02em" rspace="0.02em">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> bond releases energy.

content.answer: The reaction is endothermic because breaking the <math alttext="O to O double" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo lspace="0.02em" rspace="0.02em">=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> bond requires energy.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
